intro: Petasites frigidus var. genuinus, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter, with a thick, spongy texture. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in early spring, typically in clusters of 5 to 10. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
